sense.gloss: fierce (fight, competition, etc.), severe, hot, hard, bitter, keen, cutthroat
to build (a fire), to make, to start, to light
glowing ember (either red hot charcoal or the glowing remains of burnt firewood), live charcoal
to be kindled (fire), to be made
to catch fire (of charcoal), to start burning, to burn away, to burn merrily

sdata.j: このままでは↑熾烈↑↓しれつ↓な↑情報↑↓じょうほう↓↑戦↑↓せん↓に↑勝↑↓か↓てない。ＣＩＯの↑首↑↓くび↓を↑挿↑↓す↓げ↑替↑↓か↓えよう。
sdata.e: This is a bruising information war. At this rate we'll never come out on top. We've got to replace our CIO.

sdata.j: ↑無人島↑↓むじんとう↓に↑置↑↓お↓き↑去↑↓ざ↓りにされた↑時↑↓とき↓のために、↑火↑↓ひ↓の↑熾↑↓おこ↓し↑方↑↓かた↓を↑知↑↓し↓っとくのって↑大事↑↓だいじ↓だよ。
sdata.e: It's important to know how to build a fire in case you're stranded on a desert island.

sdata.j: ↑無人島↑↓むじんとう↓に↑取↑↓と↓り↑残↑↓のこ↓さた↑場合↑↓ばあい↓に↑備↑↓そな↓え、↑火↑↓ひ↓の↑熾↑↓おこ↓し↑方↑↓かた↓を↑知↑↓し↓っておくことは↑大切↑↓たいせつ↓です。
sdata.e: It's important to know how to build a fire in case you're stranded on a desert island.
